UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, BERKELEY   
Berkeley, CA
BA with Honors, field major in the Social Sciences
Experience
Summer 2000
GOLDMAN SACHS
New York, NY
Summer Associate

Helped conduct due diligence and write S-1 for IPO of unregulated electricity generator

Contributed to sales memo and worked with senior management to execute $100M IPO of 
microturbine firm; stock gained 200% on first day of trading and maintains consistent ratings

Helped position industry trends, run merger analyses and pitch for sale of semiconductor firm

Participated on two-person team to write offering memorandum, conduct valuation and 
identify buyers for $60M insurance asset divestiture
1999-present
MIT ENERGY LABORATORY
Cambridge, MA
Graduate Research Assistant, China Energy Technology Program (sponsored by ABB, Ltd.)

Simulating electricity service planning and financing scenarios for Shandong province, China

Recommending power generation strategies that minimize the costs of providing electricity, 
enhance peak load management and reduce emissions
1994-1998
COLORADO HOUSING AND FINANCE AUTHORITY
Denver, CO
Training Director, E-Star™ Program  
E-Star™ was the first program in the US to gain the full endorsement of Fannie Mae and Freddie 
Mac in addition to FHA and VA for Energy Mortgages, products that allow underwriting 
concessions for buyers of energy efficient homes.

Developed the country’s first Energy Mortgage training curriculum to span the conventional 
and governmental secondary markets

Recruited and personally trained over 1500 lending, realty and appraisal companies 

Coordinated underwriting for $23M in loans for low-income borrowers in rural Colorado

Served as division liaison with trade associations, secondary markets and regulatory agencies

Re-engineered the screening, certification and QA processes for over 100 energy auditors

Cultivated partnerships between rural utilities, mortgage lenders, and building codes 
departments to offer incentives for homebuilders and buyers of energy efficient homes

Invited to speak nationally to promote similar programs
1992-1993         WINDSURF BICYCLE WAREHOUSE
San Francisco, CA
Salesperson
 
1991-1992
CONDOMINIUM MANAGEMENT COMPANY
Winter Park, CO
Assistant to Manager, Hideaway Village Resort
Personal

Participant in Massachusetts Roundtable on Electricity Restructuring

Interests include backcountry and alpine skiing, mountain biking and running
